intro: Hexatheca fulva subsp. fulva, commonly known as the smooth hexatheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine, smooth layer of wax. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or dry inland regions.
